body_html: I didn't notice that, but I think it's better to keep it a tuple, so that the attribute types are the same for any dimension. We should change other pooling functions too, but just leave it for now, because it will need some additional __setattr__ methods for backward compatibility.
body_text: I didn't notice that, but I think it's better to keep it a tuple, so that the attribute types are the same for any dimension. We should change other pooling functions too, but just leave it for now, because it will need some additional __setattr__ methods for backward compatibility.
body: I didn't notice that, but I think it's better to keep it a tuple, so that the attribute types are the same for any dimension. We should change other pooling functions too, but just leave it for now, because it will need some additional `__setattr__` methods for backward compatibility.
